Description: Glazed steatite scarab, drab white in colour; on the base is a sphinx, an ankh sign and a winged snake.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hala Sultan Tekke, Tomb V
Curator's comments: Bailey considered that this scarab was not of Egyptian manufacture, but both Peltenburg and Jacobsson include it in their studies of Egyptian imports to Cyprus in this period.
Bibliographic references: Bailey 1976 / Hala Sultan Tekke I. Excavations 1897-1971 (p.14, pl.XIIIa-e)
SCE IV/1D / The Swedish Cyprus Expedition. Vol. IV. Part 1D. The Late Cypriot Bronze Age. Other arts and crafts (p.654)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 278)
